name: Instant Pot Chicken Cacciatore
ingredients: {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '(6 ounce)', 'name': 'bone-in chicken thighs, with skin'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(4 ounce) package', 'name': 'sliced fresh mushrooms'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'stalks', 'name': 'celery, chopped'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': '', 'name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(14 ounce) can', 'name': 'stewed tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'tomato paste'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'herbes de Provence'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cubes', 'name': 'chicken bouillon, crumbled'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'red pepper flakes (Optional)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'ground black pepper to taste (Optional)'}
steps: Gather the ingredients.. Rinse chicken thighs and pat dry with paper towels. Heat oil in the pot of an electric pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot) on Sauté mode; add chicken. Cook until browned, about 6 minutes per side. Transfer chicken to a plate, reserving drippings in the pot.. Place mushrooms, celery, and onion in the pot; cook and stir until soft, about 5 minutes. Add garlic; cook until fragrant, about 2 minutes. Place chicken back in the pot; add tomatoes and tomato paste. Sprinkle with herbes de Provence. Top with water and bouillon.. Close and lock the lid. Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions. Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build. Cook for 11 minutes.. Release pressure carefully using the quick-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 5 minutes. Unlock and remove the lid carefully, turning it away from you. Test chicken for doneness; an instant-read thermometer inserted near the bone should read 165 degrees F (74 degrees C). Season to taste with red pepper flakes and black pepper.

name: Chicken Cacciatore in a Slow Cooker
ingredients: {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '', 'name': 'skinless, boneless chicken breast halves'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(28 ounce) jar', 'name': 'spaghetti sauce (such as Classico® Cabernet Marinara with Herbs)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(6 ounce) can', 'name': 'tomato paste'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'ounces', 'name': 'sliced fresh mushrooms'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': '', 'name': 'yellow onion, minced'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': '', 'name': 'green bell pepper, seeded and diced'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'minced garlic'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'dried oregano'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'dried basil'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'red pepper flakes (Optional)'}
steps: Gather all ingredients.. Place chicken in a slow cooker.. Stir in spaghetti sauce, tomato paste, mushrooms, onion, bell pepper, garlic, oregano, basil, black pepper, and red pepper flakes.. Cover and cook on Low until chicken is tender, 6 to 8 hours.

name: Mom's Chicken Cacciatore
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'all-purpose flour for coating'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(4 pound)', 'name': 'chicken, cut into pieces'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'green bell pepper, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(14.5 ounce) can', 'name': 'diced tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'dried oregano'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white wine'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'fresh mushrooms, quartered'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and pepper to taste'}
steps: Combine the flour, salt and pepper in a plastic bag. Shake the chicken pieces in flour until coated. Heat the oil in a large skillet (one that has a cover/lid). Fry the chicken pieces until they are browned on both sides. Remove from skillet.. Add the onion, garlic and bell pepper to the skillet and saute until the onion is slightly browned. Return the chicken to the skillet and add the tomatoes, oregano and wine. Cover and simmer for 30 minutes over medium low heat.. Add the mushrooms and salt and pepper to taste. Simmer for 10 more minutes.

name: Chicken Cacciatore Pasta
ingredients: {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '(11 ounce)', 'name': 'chicken leg quarters'}, {'quantity': '1 ¾', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'salt, or more to taste, divided'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'red bell pepper, cut into strips'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'sliced onion'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'chopped fresh oregano'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'dried thyme'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(28 ounce) can', 'name': 'tomato puree'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(15.5 ounce) can', 'name': 'cannellini beans, drained and rinsed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'red wine vinegar'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'ounces', 'name': 'dried fusilli or penne pasta'}
steps: Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).. Sprinkle chicken with 1 teaspoon salt. Heat oil in a wide, heavy, oven-safe pot over medium-high heat until hot but not smoking, about 1 minute. Add chicken, skin sides down, and cook, turning once, until browned, about 10 minutes. Transfer to a plate.. Pour off all but 2 tablespoons fat. Reduce heat to medium and cook pepper, onion, and garlic, stirring, until softened, about 5 minutes. Stir in oregano, thyme, tomato puree, water, and remaining 3/4 teaspoon salt; bring to a simmer. Return chicken to pot, return to a simmer, cover, and transfer to oven. Bake until chicken is tender, 45 to 50 minutes.. Transfer chicken to a bowl and chill, uncovered, until cool enough to handle (20 minutes). Discard skin and bones. Pull meat into coarse shreds.. Add chicken, beans, and vinegar to tomato mixture in pot and simmer until heated through, about 5 minutes.. Meanwhile, cook pasta in salted water according to package directions. Drain, reserving 1 cup pasta water. Stir pasta into chicken mixture, thinning with pasta water as needed. Season with additional salt, if desired.

name: Italian Chicken Cacciatore
ingredients: {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'olive oil, divided'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'onion, diced'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'freshly ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': '', 'name': 'chicken thighs'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'dry white wine'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '(14.5 ounce) cans', 'name': 'diced tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'tomato paste'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'white sugar, or more to taste'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and ground black pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chicken broth, or more as needed'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'black olives, pitted'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'chopped fresh parsley'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'torn basil leaves'}
steps: Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in a skillet over medium heat and cook onion, stirring often, until soft and translucent, about 5 minutes. Transfer to a pot.. Combine flour, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper in a large bowl. Toss chicken thighs in the flour mixture until evenly coated.. Heat remaining 2 tablespoons olive oil in the skillet over medium heat, add chicken thighs, and brown on one side, without turning, for 5 minutes. Turn and cook until browned on the other side, about 5 minutes more. Transfer browned chicken thighs to the pot.. Pour white wine into the skillet; bring to a boil. Stir to loosen all the browned bits of chicken and flavors in the skillet pour into the pot. Add diced tomatoes, tomato paste, and sugar; season with salt and pepper. Add as much chicken stock as needed to cover the chicken. Cover pot and simmer over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until chicken is no longer pink in the center, about 45 minutes.. Stir in olives, parsley, and basil. Stir to heat through.

name: Chef John's Chicken Cacciatore
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'whole', 'name': 'roasting chicken, cut in quarters'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'onion, sliced'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'ounces', 'name': 'fresh mushrooms, quartered'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, sliced'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'sprigs', 'name': 'rosemary'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'dried oregano'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'red pepper flakes, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'tomato sauce'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and ground black pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'red bell peppers, sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'green bell peppers, sliced'}
steps: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).. Heat olive oil in a large Dutch oven over medium-high heat; add chicken and cook until browned on the outside. Remove to a bowl to capture the juices.. Stir in onions and mushrooms; cook for 5-6 minutes until soft. Add a big pinch of salt and pepper. Stir in garlic, rosemary, red pepper flakes, oregano, tomato sauce, and water.. Place chicken pieces and any juices that have accumulated in the bowl on top of the cooked vegetables. Add more salt and pepper. Place pepper slices on top of the chicken.. Cover and cook in the preheated oven for 1 hour 15 minutes.

name: Slow Cooker Chicken Cacciatore
ingredients: {'quantity': '6', 'unit': '', 'name': 'skinless, boneless chicken breast halves'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(28 ounce) jar', 'name': 'spaghetti sauce'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'green bell pepper, seeded and cubed'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'ounces', 'name': 'fresh mushrooms, sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'onion, finely diced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'minced garlic'}
steps: Put the chicken in the slow cooker. Top with the spaghetti sauce, green bell peppers, mushrooms, onion, and garlic.. Cover, and cook on Low for 7 to 9 hours.

name: Boneless Chicken Cacciatore
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '', 'name': 'skinless, boneless chicken breasts, cubed'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'stalks', 'name': 'celery, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'red bell pepper, chopped'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': '', 'name': 'green bell pepper, chopped'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(14.5 ounce) can', 'name': 'diced tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'tomato juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(6 ounce) can', 'name': 'tomato paste'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'dried parsley'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'dried basil'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'dried oregano'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'dried marjoram'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}
steps: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add chicken and cook until no longer pink in the middle, 5 to 7 minutes. Stir in celery, onion, bell peppers, garlic, tomatoes, tomato juice, tomato paste, parsley, salt, basil, oregano, marjoram, and black pepper. Cover and let simmer until vegetables are no longer crispy, about 10 minutes.

name: Chicken Cacciatore with Rice
ingredients: {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'pounds', 'name': 'skinless, boneless chicken breasts, cut into strips'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped onion'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(28 ounce) can', 'name': 'whole peeled tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(8 ounce) can', 'name': 'tomato sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'green bell pepper strips'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'dried basil'}, {'quantity': '⅛', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'cayenne pepper'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'uncooked instant rice'}
steps: Heat oil in a pot over medium heat. Add chicken, onion, and garlic; cook until chicken is browned and onion and garlic are softened, 8 to 10 minutes.. Stir in tomatoes, tomato sauce, bell pepper, salt, basil, and cayenne pepper; bring to boil. Cook for 5 minutes.. Stir in rice, cover, and remove from the heat. Let stand until rice is tender, about 5 minutes. Stir before serving.

name: Scarlett's Chicken Cacciatore
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'skinless, boneless chicken breast halves, cubed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'onion, diced'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': '', 'name': 'green bell pepper, diced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'sliced fresh mushrooms'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'clove', 'name': 'garlic, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(28 ounce) can', 'name': 'Italian-style crushed tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'chopped fresh parsley'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'Italian seasoning'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'dried basil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(8 ounce) package', 'name': 'egg noodles'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'grated Parmesan cheese'}
steps: Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat, and cook and stir the chicken, onion, green pepper, mushrooms, and garlic until the chicken is no longer pink inside, 10 to 15 minutes. Stir in the crushed tomatoes, parsley, salt, pepper, Italian seasoning, and basil, bring the mixture to a boil, and reduce heat. Cover the skillet and simmer for 30 minutes.. While the chicken mixture is simmering, fill a large pot with lightly salted water and bring to a rolling boil over high heat. Once the water is boiling, stir in the egg noodles, and return to a boil. Cook the noodles uncovered, stirring occasionally, until cooked through but still firm to the bite, about 5 minutes. Drain well in a colander set in the sink.. Serve the chicken cacciatore over the hot cooked noodles. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese before serving.

name: Easy Chicken Cacciatore
ingredients: {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped onion'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped green bell pepper'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'clove', 'name': 'garlic, chopped'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'chicken meat, cooked and cubed'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'whole peeled tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'green beans'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'dried oregano'}
steps: Sauté onion, bell pepper, and garlic in a large skillet until soft. Add chicken, then stir in tomatoes, beans, and oregano.. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer, stirring constantly, for 8 to 10 minutes. Remove from heat and serve hot.

name: Hunter Style Chicken Cacciatore
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '(28 ounce) cans', 'name': 'whole peeled plum tomatoes with juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(6 ounce) can', 'name': 'tomato paste'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'red wine'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'dried oregano'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'dried basil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'olive oil, divided'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'carrot, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'stalk', 'name': 'celery, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'green bell peppers, cut into chunks'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'onions, cut into chunks'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'fresh mushrooms, sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'eggs'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': 'pounds', 'name': 'skinless, boneless chicken pieces'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'pounds', 'name': 'dry linguine pasta'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped fresh parsley'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'freshly shredded Parmesan cheese, or to taste'}
steps: Heat 2 teaspoons of olive oil in a large pot over low heat, and cook and stir the garlic until tender but not browned, about 3 minutes. Pour in the tomatoes with their juice, and mash with a potato masher to leave the tomatoes in chunks. Stir in tomato paste, red wine, sugar, oregano, basil, salt, and black pepper, and mix until the tomato paste is smoothly combined into the sauce. Bring to a simmer, and cook, stirring often, while you prepare the vegetables.. Heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a skillet over medium heat, and cook and stir the carrot and celery until tender, 5 to 8 minutes. Stir into the sauce. In the same skillet, cook and stir the green peppers and onions until the onions are translucent, 5 to 8 more minutes; mix them to the sauce. Heat 1 more tablespoon of olive oil in the skillet, and cook and stir the mushrooms until they give up their liquid, about 10 minutes; stir the mushrooms into the sauce. Allow sauce to simmer while you cook the chicken.. Beat the eggs in a bowl. Place the flour in a separate shallow bowl. Heat 1/4 cup of olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Dip chicken pieces in egg, then dredge in flour. Tap off any excess flour, and brown the chicken pieces in the hot oil until browned on both sides, about 15 minutes. Set the chicken pieces aside.. Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).. Spoon about 1 cup of the tomato sauce into the bottom of a large Dutch oven. Place the chicken pieces into the Dutch oven, and pour remaining sauce and vegetables over the chicken; cover.. Bake in the preheated oven until the chicken is tender and no longer pink inside, about 1 hour. If sauce begins to boil harder than a simmer, reduce oven heat to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C).. About 15 minutes before serving time, bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Stir in the linguine pasta, bring back to a boil, and cook, stirring often, until the linguine is tender but still slightly firm, 10 to 12 minutes. Drain the pasta well.. Turn the linguine out onto a large platter, and top with the chicken and sauce. Sprinkle with parsley and Parmesan cheese to serve.

name: Best Instant Pot® Chicken Cacciatore
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'skinless, boneless chicken thighs'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'skinless, boneless chicken breasts, halved lengthwise'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'sea salt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'fresh ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'cornstarch'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'extra-virgin olive oil, divided'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'stalks', 'name': 'celery, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(8 ounce) package', 'name': 'sliced fresh mushrooms'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'green bell pepper, diced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'red bell pepper, diced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'jarred roasted red bell peppers, chopped'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'dry Cabernet Sauvignon'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'tomato paste'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'red pepper flakes, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'garlic powder'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'onion powder'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'chicken bouillon granules'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'Italian seasoning'}
steps: Dredge chicken thighs and breasts with salt, pepper, and flour.. Turn on a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot®) and select Saute function. Heat 1/2 the olive oil. Add chicken and cook until browned on both sides, flipping halfway using tongs, about 10 minutes. Transfer chicken to a plate.. Heat remaining olive oil in the pot. Saute celery and onion until translucent, about 3 minutes. Add garlic; stir in mushrooms, green bell pepper, diced red bell pepper, and roasted red pepper. Saute until fragrant, about 1 minute more.. Return chicken to pot. Add Cabernet Sauvignon, tomato paste, red pepper flakes, garlic powder, onion powder, bouillon, and Italian seasoning. Close and lock the lid. Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 11 minutes. Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.. Release pressure carefully using the quick-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 5 minutes. Unlock and remove lid.

name: Homemade Chicken Cacciatore, Sicilian-Style
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'unsalted butter'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'green bell pepper, sliced thin'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'minced garlic'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '(14.5 ounce) cans', 'name': 'diced tomatoes, drained and juice reserved'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'Burgundy wine'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'Italian seasoning'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'garlic salt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'whole chicken, cut into pieces'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(16 ounce) package', 'name': 'spaghetti'}
steps: Melt butter in a large stockpot over medium heat. Add onion, bell pepper, and garlic; cook until begins to soften, about 3 minutes. Add tomatoes, wine, Italian seasoning, salt, black pepper, and garlic salt; cook and stir until mixture just begins to boil.. Reduce heat to medium low; add chicken and cook until meat is fall-off-the-bone tender, about 1 1/2 hours. Remove bones and skin from chicken; return meat to the pot.. Place 3/4 cup reserved canned tomato liquid in a microwave-safe bowl; microwave until just warmed. Stir in flour until thick; stir into the pot, stirring continuously, until begins to thicken. Remove from heat and allow to sit for about 15 minutes.. Meanwhile, bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook spaghetti in the boiling water, stirring occasionally, until tender yet still firm to the bite, about 12 minutes. Drain. Serve chicken cacciatore over spaghetti.

name: Ellen's Chicken Cacciatore
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': '', 'name': 'boneless, skinless chicken thighs - fat trimmed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(8 ounce) package', 'name': 'sliced fresh mushrooms'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(28 ounce) can', 'name': 'diced tomatoes with juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'dry white wine'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'orange juice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'dried rosemary, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and ground black pepper to taste'}
steps: Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat, and brown the chicken thighs in the hot oil, about 5 minutes per side. Set the chicken aside.. In the same skillet, cook and stir the onion and mushrooms until the mushrooms have softened, about 10 minutes. Mix in the garlic, and cook until fragrant, 1 to 2 more minutes.. Pour in the tomatoes with their juice, white wine, orange juice, rosemary, salt, and black pepper, and stir until thoroughly combined.. Stir in the chicken pieces and any accumulated juices, cover the skillet, and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer until the chicken is tender and no longer pink inside, 30 to 40 minutes.

name: Caper Chicken Cacciatore
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(4 pound)', 'name': 'chicken, cut into pieces'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'onions, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh sliced mushrooms'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(14.5 ounce) can', 'name': 'stewed tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(10.75 ounce) can', 'name': 'condensed cream of mushroom soup'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white wine'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'pitted green olives'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'black olives'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'capers'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'ounces', 'name': 'pepperoni sausage, sliced'}
steps: In a large skillet heat oil over medium heat. Season chicken pieces with salt and pepper to taste and brown chicken in hot oil. Remove chicken from skillet. Set aside.. In same skillet saute onions and mushrooms until translucent. Return chicken to skillet and add the tomatoes, soup and wine. When liquids start to simmer add the green olives, black olives, capers and pepperoni. Cover skillet and let simmer for 30 minutes.. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Remove skillet cover, pour skillet mixture into a 9x13 inch baking dish and bake in preheated oven for about 15 minutes, until chicken is tender and juices run clear.

name: Northern Italian-Style Chicken Cacciatore
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(4 pound)', 'name': 'whole chicken, cut into 4 pieces'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(8 ounce) package', 'name': 'mushrooms, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'stalk', 'name': 'celery, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'dry white wine'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(14 ounce) can', 'name': 'diced tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chicken broth'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped fresh parsley'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'dried oregano'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'red pepper flakes'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and ground black pepper to taste'}
steps: Rinse chicken pieces and pat dry.. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add chicken and brown, 4 to 5 minutes per side. Remove chicken to a plate.. Add mushrooms, onion, and celery to the pan drippings and sauté until soft, about 5 minutes. Add garlic and cook until fragrant, about 2 more minutes.. Return chicken to the skillet. Add white wine and cook until it has almost completely evaporated, 2 to 3 minutes. Add diced tomatoes, chicken broth, parsley, oregano, pepper flakes, salt, and pepper. Cover and simmer until chicken is no longer pink at the bone and the juices run clear, about 30 minutes.

name: Chicken Cacciatore with Creamy Mashed Potatoes
ingredients: {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'red potatoes, cut into 1-inch chunks'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'small fresh cauliflower florets'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '(4 ounce)', 'name': 'boneless skinless chicken breast halves'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'KRAFT Lite Balsamic Vinaigrette Dressing'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(8 ounce) package', 'name': 'sliced fresh mushrooms'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'green bell pepper, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'yellow bell pepper, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(14.5 ounce) can', 'name': 'Italian-style diced tomatoes, undrained'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'PHILADELPHIA Chive & Onion 1/3 Less Fat than Cream Cheese'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped fresh basil'}
steps: Cook potatoes and cauliflower in boiling water in large saucepan 20 min. or until tender.. Meanwhile, cook chicken in large nonstick skillet sprayed with cooking spray on medium heat 3 to 4 min. on each side or until golden brown. Transfer to plate; cover to keep warm.. Add dressing, mushrooms and peppers to skillet; cook and stir 6 min. Add tomatoes; simmer 8 min. Return chicken to skillet; spoon sauce over chicken. Simmer 3 min. or until chicken is done (165 degrees F).. Drain potato mixture; return to pan. Add reduced-fat cream cheese; mash until potato mixture is fluffy. Serve topped with chicken, vegetables and basil.

name: Chicken Cacciatore Rice Bowl
ingredients: {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Salt and ground black pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'pounds', 'name': 'boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cut into 1-inch pieces'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'red bell pepper, seeded and chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'yellow onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'dry white wine'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chicken broth'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(24 ounce) jar', 'name': 'RAGÚ® Old World Style® Traditional Sauce'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'cooked brown rice'}
steps: Mix together a large pinch of salt and pepper with the flour in a large bowl. Add the chicken pieces and toss until evenly coated with flour mixture.. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook chicken for about 4 minutes, turning well so each side is evenly browned. Remove to a plate. In the same skillet, saute the pepper, onion, and garlic until the onion is soft and translucent, about 5 minutes. Add wine and chicken broth; simmer until it is reduced by half. Finally, pour in the tomato sauce and add the browned chicken pieces. Simmer for 5 minutes, or until thickened.. Divide the rice into four deep bowls and top with even amounts of the chicken cacciatore. Serve hot.

name: Chicken Cacciatore II
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '(3 pound)', 'name': 'whole chickens, each cut into 8 pieces'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and ground black pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'yellow onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'green bell pepper, seeded and chopped'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'white button mushrooms, quartered'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'chopped fresh oregano'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(28 ounce) can', 'name': 'whole peeled tomatoes in juice, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'tomato paste'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white wine'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'chicken stock'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'capers, drained and rinsed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'coarsely chopped fresh basil'}
steps: Season the chicken pieces with salt and black pepper.. Place the flour in a shallow bowl. Press each chicken piece into the flour and tap off excess.. Heat the olive oil in a large Dutch oven over medium heat until almost smoking hot.. Pan-fry the chicken until golden brown on both sides, about 3 minutes per side. Work in batches so as to not overcrowd the pan. Set the browned chicken aside.. Stir the onion, green bell pepper, and garlic into the Dutch oven; cook, stirring occasionally, until tender, about 5 minutes.. Stir in the mushroom; cook until they release their juice, 5 to 8 more minutes.. Mix in oregano, tomatoes, tomato paste, white wine, and chicken stock; bring to a boil.. Return the chicken pieces to the sauce, cover the pan, reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer until the chicken is no longer pink inside and the juices run clear, 30 to 40 minutes.. Stir in capers and sprinkle with basil to serve.

name: Chicken Cacciatore Delight
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(3 pound)', 'name': 'whole chicken, cut into pieces'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'peanut oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'onions, cut into thin rings'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped green bell pepper'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(8 ounce) package', 'name': 'sliced fresh mushrooms'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(14.5 ounce) can', 'name': 'crushed tomatoes, drained'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(8 ounce) can', 'name': 'tomato sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'dried oregano'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'sherry'}
steps: Rinse and pat the chicken pieces dry with paper towels, then coat with flour in a bowl or a resealable plastic zipper bag. Heat the peanut oil in a large skillet over medium heat, and brown the chicken on all sides until golden brown, about 15 minutes. Remove the chicken, and set aside in a bowl.. Cook the onions, green bell pepper, and garlic in the oil left in the hot skillet until the onion slices are translucent, about 5 minutes; stir in mushrooms, and cook and stir until the mushrooms have given up their liquid and are almost tender, about 10 more minutes. Pour in crushed tomatoes, tomato sauce, salt, oregano, and sherry, and mix well; stir in the chicken pieces and any juices that have collected.. Simmer until the chicken meat is tender and no longer pink in the thickest part of a thigh, and the juices run clear, 30 to 40 minutes.

name: Spicy Slow Cooker Chicken Cacciatore with Wine
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'pounds', 'name': 'skinless, boneless chicken breasts'}, {'quantity': '2 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'red wine'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'onion, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'green bell pepper, seeded and chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'yellow bell pepper, seeded and chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'orange bell pepper, seeded and chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'red bell pepper, seeded and chopped'}, {'quantity': '7', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'minced garlic'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'red pepper flakes, or more to taste'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'Italian seasoning'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and ground black pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '(15 ounce) cans', 'name': 'diced tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '(15 ounce) cans', 'name': 'tomato sauce'}
steps: The night before cooking, layer ingredients into a slow cooker in the following order: chicken, wine, onion, bell peppers, garlic, red pepper flakes, Italian seasoning, salt, pepper, diced tomatoes, sugar, and tomato sauce. Cover and place in the refrigerator so chicken can soak up the wine, 8 hours to overnight.. The next morning, remove from the refrigerator and cook on Low, stirring occasionally, for 6 hours. Remove chicken and shred meat with 2 forks; return meat to the cooker.. Cook on High with lid slightly off to allow juices to evaporate and sauce to condense, about 2 more hours.

name: My Italian Grandfather's Chicken Cacciatore
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'extra-virgin olive oil, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': '(8 ounce)', 'name': 'chicken leg quarters with skin'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'bell pepper, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'stalk', 'name': 'celery with leaves, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'carrot, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(6 ounce) can', 'name': 'tomato paste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(28 ounce) can', 'name': 'crushed San Marzano tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'red wine'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'ground allspice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'bay leaf'}, {'quantity': '⅛', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'seasoning sauce (such as Maggi®)'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and ground black pepper to taste'}
steps: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).. Heat olive oil in a Dutch oven over medium-high heat until shimmering. Add chicken and cook until well browned, 3 to 4 minutes per side. Remove to a plate.. Reduce heat to medium and add bell pepper, onion, celery, carrot, and garlic. Sauté until translucent, about 5 minutes. Add tomato paste and stir to blend into the vegetables.. Add crushed tomatoes, wine, allspice, bay leaf, seasoning sauce, salt, and pepper. Return chicken to the pan and toss to coat all pieces.. Cover the Dutch oven and place in the preheated oven. Braise until chicken is falling off the bone and the juices run clear, 1 1/2 to 2 hours. An instant-read thermometer inserted near the bone should read 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).

name: Pollo alla Cacciatore
ingredients: {'quantity': '12', 'unit': '', 'name': 'green olives, pitted'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'stalk', 'name': 'celery, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'onions, sliced'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'extra-virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(2 pound)', 'name': 'whole chicken, cut into pieces'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '', 'name': 'ripe tomatoes, diced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'fresh basil, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'lemon, juiced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'capers'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and ground black pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'extra-virgin olive oil, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': '', 'name': 'potatoes, peeled and cubed'}
steps: Bring a small pot of water to a boil. Add olives and celery; simmer until celery is bright green, about 30 seconds. Drain well.. Combine onions, water, and sugar in a saucepan over medium heat. Cover and cook, stirring occasionally, until onions are soft and caramelized, about 30 minutes.. Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook chicken pieces until browned, about 4 minutes per side.. Transfer chicken pieces to a large saucepan; add olives, celery, caramelized onions, tomatoes, basil, lemon juice, capers, salt, and pepper. Cover and cook over medium heat until chicken is no longer pink in the center, about 1 hour.. Heat 1/4 cup olive oil in a deep skillet. Add potatoes; cook and stir until crisp and golden brown, about 10 minutes. Stir potatoes into the saucepan shortly before removing from the heat.

name: Elise's Slow Cooker Chicken Cacciatore
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(28 ounce) can', 'name': 'diced tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'dry red wine'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chicken stock'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'tomato paste'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cubes', 'name': 'chicken bouillon'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'pounds', 'name': 'skinless, boneless chicken breast halves'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'dried Italian seasoning'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'extra-virgin olive oil, or as needed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'bell peppers, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'red onion, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'sliced crimini mushrooms (baby bella)'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'sliced black olives (Optional)'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'prepared pesto (Genovese)'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'white sugar, or to taste'}
steps: Preheat a slow cooker on High.. Stir tomatoes, wine, chicken stock, tomato paste, and chicken bouillon together in a large bowl. Trim chicken as necessary; sprinkle with Italian herb blend.. Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium-low heat. Cook chicken breasts until browned, 3 to 5 minutes per side. Transfer chicken to slow cooker along with any accumulated juices.. Place bell peppers, onion, mushrooms, and garlic in skillet, along with more olive oil if needed. Cook and stir until onion is translucent, about 5 minutes. Stir in flour; cook until vegetables are soft, about 5 minutes.. Stir in tomato mixture; bring to a boil. Simmer until thickened slightly, about 5 minutes more. Stir in olives; transfer mixture to slow cooker.. Reduce slow cooker heat to Low and cook until chicken is very tender, 5 1/2 to 6 1/2 hours. Stir pesto and sugar into chicken mixture; cook for 30 minutes more.

name: Easy Weeknight Chicken Cacciatore
ingredients: {'quantity': '3', 'unit': '(8 ounce)', 'name': 'bone-in chicken legs with skin'}, {'quantity': '⅔', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'green bell pepper, cut into 2-inch pieces'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'onion, sliced'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, sliced, or more to taste'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'dried oregano'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'red pepper flakes'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(32 ounce) jar', 'name': 'roasted red pepper and garlic tomato sauce'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'water, or as needed'}
steps: Dip chicken pieces in flour and shake off excess.. Heat oil in a 10-inch skillet over medium-high heat. Add chicken and brown well, 4 to 5 minutes per side. Remove chicken from the pan and set aside. Drain most of the oil from the skillet, leaving about 1/8 inch.. Add bell pepper, onion, garlic, oregano, pepper flakes, salt, and pepper to the skillet. Sauté, stirring constantly, for 2 minutes. Pour in spaghetti sauce and add enough water to thin mixture just a little; sauce will thicken as it cooks. Stir well and add chicken to the sauce. Spoon sauce over chicken to coat and bring to a simmer.. Cover, lower heat, and cook, turning chicken and scraping the bottom of the pan often, until chicken is no longer pink at the bone and the juices run clear, about 40 minutes.

name: Chicken Cacciatore Sandwich
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'olive oil, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '7', 'unit': 'ounces', 'name': 'fresh mushrooms, quartered'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'red onion, sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'clove', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'fluid ounces', 'name': 'sherry wine'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'ounce', 'name': 'capers'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'dried oregano'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'dried basil'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'marinara sauce'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'pounds', 'name': 'shredded cooked chicken breast'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': '(6 inch)', 'name': 'hoagie rolls, split lengthwise'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'slices', 'name': 'provolone cheese'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'sliced black olives, or to taste'}
steps: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add mushrooms, onion, and garlic; sauté until onions are translucent, about 5 minutes.. Add sherry, capers, oregano, and basil; cook until 1/2 of the sherry has cooked out. Add marinara sauce. Stir in chicken and cook until sauce has reduced by a third, 5 to 7 minutes.. While the sauce is reducing, set an oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler.. Place split hoagie rolls on a baking sheet and top each with a slice of provolone cheese.. Broil until cheese is melted and rolls are toasted, 1 to 2 minutes.. Fill each toasted bun with chicken mixture and top with sliced olives.

name: Hearty Chicken Cacciatore Soup with Rice
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(32 ounce) container', 'name': 'chicken broth'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '(10.5 ounce) cans', 'name': 'condensed tomato soup'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '(10.5 ounce) cans', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(16 ounce) can', 'name': 'diced tomatoes with juice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'salt-free vegetable seasoning, divided'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'butter'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '(8 ounce)', 'name': 'boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cubed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(8 ounce) can', 'name': 'sliced mushrooms, drained'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'onion, diced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'garlic salt'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'water, or more as needed'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'uncooked long grain rice'}
steps: Combine chicken broth, condensed soup, 2 cans water, diced tomatoes, and 1 tablespoon vegetable seasoning in an 8-quart stockpot over medium heat; bring to a slow, rolling boil.. Meanwhile, melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add chicken, mushrooms, onion, and remaining 1 tablespoon vegetable seasoning and cook until onion is translucent and chicken is cooked through, about 7 minutes. Stir in garlic salt, salt, and pepper.. Transfer chicken mixture to the stockpot and bring to a rolling boil. Cook, stirring frequently, for 30 minutes.. While the soup is cooking, bring 1 1/2 cups water and rice to a boil in a saucepan. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until rice is tender and water has been absorbed, 20 to 25 minutes.. Add rice to the soup and continue to simmer, adding more water to reach desired consistency, for 1 hour.
